taskbody.context:
Use this procedure to start a ZooKeeper ensemble.
This procedures uses the nc utility to query ensemble hosts. If nc is not available, you can use telnet with interactive ZooKeeper commands.
The window of time for starting a ZooKeeper ensemble is relatively short. The goal of this procedure is to restart on each ensemble node at about the same time, so that each node can participate in electing the leader.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
In a separate window, log in to the second node of the ZooKeeper ensemble (Delegate-A) .
In a different window, log in to the third node of the ZooKeeper ensemble (Delegate-B) .
On all ensemble hosts, stop and start serviced.

stepxmp.codeblock: systemctl stop serviced && systemctl start serviced

step.cmd: On the master host, check the status of the ZooKeeper ensemble.

substep.cmd: Query the master host and identify its role in the ensemble.
substep.stepxmp: Replace Master with the IP address of the master host: { echo stats; sleep 1; } | nc Master 2181 | grep Mode
substep.stepresult: The result includes Leader or Follower.

substep.cmd: Query delegate host A and identify its role in the ensemble.
substep.stepxmp: Replace Delegate-A with the IP address of the delegate host A: { echo stats; sleep 1; } | nc Delegate-A 2181 | grep Mode

substep.cmd: Query delegate host A and identify its role in the ensemble.
substep.stepxmp: Replace Delegate-A with the IP address of the delegate host A: { echo stats; sleep 1; } | nc Delegate-A 2181 | grep Mode

step.stepresult: If none of the hosts reports that it is a leader within a few minutes of starting the hosts, stop them and then retry the startup.
